intro: Thyella tamnifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thyella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
